Introduction

THETHE is a 4-member South Korean co-ed band under WOMANANDMANS. The members are the Vocalist, Leader, and Guitarist Kim Youngjun, who is the only original member since debut, the other Vocalist Lee Hyunyoung, Bassist Jeong Myeongseong, and the Drummer Im Hanguk. They debuted in 1997 with the studio album "The More The Better".

When they debuted, their Vocalist was Park Hyekyung and Drummer Lee Hyundo. They released 2 studio albums with the lineup of Kim Youngjun, Lee Hyundo and Park Hyekyung, until 1999 when Park Hyekyung left. On the release of their 3rd album "The Man In The Street" in 2001, their Vocalist was Han Heejeong, until 2003, and Lee Hyundo left in 2004. Lee Changhyun also joined the group in 2003 as a Bassist and Kim Taejeong joined as a Drummer but left later in the year. Their 4th album, "The The Band", released on April 28, 2003, won Album of the Year in 2004. From 2004-2008, the Vocalist was Myung Inhee for their 5th and 6th albums. Jo Minhyuk joined the group as a Drummer in 2006, Paku joined the group in 2008 as the Guitarist and Kim Youngjun became a Bassist. Jo Minhyuk and Lee Changhyun left the group in 2008. In 2009, Lee Hyeju became the Vocalist for a short time, only releasing one EP and Paku left. In 2011, Yang Songhyun joined the group as the Vocalist with Kim Youngjun, still a Bassist, and a new Drummer Park Gyuseok. They released 1 album until Yang Songhyun left. In 2014, Lee Hyunyoung joined as the last Vocalist. In 2015, a new Guitarist, Ra Jiwoong, joined the group. Later in 2016, another Drummer joined, who was Im Hanguk. In 2017, Park Gyuseok and Ra Jiwoong left, and the new Bassist Jeong Myeongseong joined while Kim Youngjun went back to a Guitarist. Their Keyboardist Kim Inhee also joined but left later in the year. After that, there was no more lineup changes and they are still active.
